questionTitle: Which of the following is the most commonly used standard for performing synchronization?
questionExplanation: SyncML stands for Synchronization Markup Language.

questionOption1: Data synchronization is an important Web service for mobile devices
questionOption2: Contact, calendar, and information on devices often need to be synchronized between multiple systems
questionOption3: SyncML is implemented using a SyncML server or alternatively as a SyncML hosted service
questionExplanation: The client portion of SyncML is either a browser plug-in or client connector software.

questionTitle: Which of the following data type may be synchronized by SyncML?
questionExplanation: Different servers and clients allow for the synchronization of different data types.

questionTitle: Which of the following services is an example of an SMS gateway?
questionExplanation: An SMS gateway is more reliable and faster than SMS itself.

questionOption1: The CnML protocol finds support in a number of products from major mobile software and hardware vendors
questionOption2: The desktop-to-mobile sync application Windows Mobile Device Center allows a mobile client to synchronize to a desktop
questionOption3: Desktop ActiveSync is not supported by some third-party mail servers
questionExplanation: An open-source version of ActiveSync called SynCE exists.

questionTitle: Which of the following allows you to attach sounds, pictures, icons, and even formatted text with your message?
questionExplanation: Not all texting systems are SMS, even if they appear so. RIM BlackBerry and NTT DoCoMo i-mode use SMTP to send short messages.

questionTitle: Which of the following uses a combination of WAP and SMS for its transport?
questionExplanation: MMS supports the sending of audio, video, and even animation with the SMS text.

questionTitle: Which of the following protocol is used for transaction monitoring service based on a request/response mechanism?
questionExplanation: WTP stands for Wireless Transaction Protocol.

questionTitle: Which of the following public-key encryption methods is used for the same purpose as TLS?
questionExplanation: WTLS stands for Wireless Transport Layer Security.

questionTitle: Which of the following provides unreliable data transport data formatting?
questionExplanation: WAE is a set of application specific markup languages.
